title: EAST COAST deserves a legitimate update @Riot
body:
East coast and surrounding areas have been ignored for far too long.
We deserve an actual update on this issue and considering you have accumulated in excess of $ONE BILLION USD as of 2014 there is NO excuse for this blatantly unprofessional behavior from a company of this caliber.If you can't admit that the Chinese company,Tencent which owns Riot,refuses to provide funding to the NA region or whatever the case may be;WE DESERVE AN ANSWER.
China has TWENTY SEVEN servers throughout their country,while NA,which is running off of ONE SERVER doesn't deserve at least a centralized server to balance the ping disadvantage where the vast majority of people in NA live?

I for one have already given up on playing with a constant ping over 140,but this won't stop me from making a post every single day until these PAYING CUSTOMERS get the recognition and treatment they deserve which is around FIVE YEARS over-due.

Shame on this stingy ,parsimonious company for further establishing that they care about nothing more than filling their pockets with customers money while spitting in their face and feeding them false hopes for an unjustifiably long period.

http://i.imgur.com/jGDQfqx.jpg?1

http://www.nationsonline.org/oneworld/countries_by_area.htm says that Canada is 6.7%, USA 6.5%, and China 6.4% of earths area. So really we should have more servers because of this and having to cover 2 countries. Where it comes in favor of China though is population. China has about 1.3 billion to USA 319 Million and 35.5 Million in Canada. So by population we don't need as many but when you do the math that means there is 1 server for every 50,654,074 people. If we wanted the same for USA AND Canada  we should have 7 servers for both USA and Canada for the same size population. GUys this isn't caused by riots server positions, or anything geological. 

From west to east coast you can get 30-50 ms. The reason you don't is because American ISP's 'throttle' the fuck out of packets. They just don't bother to upgrade their infastructure. 

This is whats causing your ping issues. Stop blaming riot. This issue wouldn't be happening if ISP's weren't such monopolistic cunts as they are.

Sorry to say but you're barking at the wrong tree. Try using a VPN. That will probably short fix your problem and get you under 100ms ping.

Good VPN's I've found are GoTrusted and WTFast. You'll have to contact support for specific IP's though for proper connect when using Go Trusted, but it works.
